result.markdown:
--- title: "Long time series (not scaled)" author: Raphael Saldanha date: last-modified --- This notebook aims to cluster the Brazilian municipalities considering dengue cases time-series similarities. ## Packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(lubridate) library(arrow) library(timetk) library(dtwclust) library(kableExtra) library(tictoc) ``` ::: ## Load data Load the aggregated data. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dengue <- read_parquet("../dengue-data/parquet_aggregated/dengue_md.parquet") dim(dengue) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 16772737 3 ``` ::: ::: ### Prepare data The chunk bellow executes various steps to prepare the data for clustering. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tdengue <- dengue %>% # Filter out dates after 2020-01-01, as this year is not complete filter(date < as.Date("2020-01-01")) %>% # Pad days with zero cases group_by(mun) %>% pad_by_time(date, .by = "day", .pad_value = 0, .start_date = min(dengue$date), .end_date = max(dengue$date)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Aggregate by week mutate( week = str_pad(epiweek(date), pad = 0, width = 2), year = year(date) ) %>% group_by(mun, year, week) %>% summarise(freq = sum(freq, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% ungroup() %>% # Keep only municipalities series with more than 100 cases total group_by(mun) %>% mutate(total = sum(freq, na.rm = TRUE)) %>% ungroup() %>% filter(total >= 100) %>% select(-total) %>% # Prepare time series arrange(mun) %>% pivot_wider(names_from = mun, values_from = freq) %>% select(-week) %>% t() %>% # Convert object tslist() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` `summarise()` has grouped output by 'mun', 'year'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} length(tdengue) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2953 ``` ::: ::: ## Clustering Sequence of `k` groups to be used. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} k_seq <- 3:10 ``` ::: ### SBD method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tic() clust <- tsclust( series = tdengue, type = "partitional", k = k_seq, distance = "sbd", seed = 13 ) toc() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 29.849 sec elapsed ``` ::: ::: ### Cluster Validity Indices (CVI) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} names(clust) <- paste0("k_", k_seq) res_cvi <- sapply(clust, cvi, type = "internal") %>% t() %>% as_tibble(rownames = "k") %>% arrange(-Sil) res_cvi %>% kbl() %>% kable_styling() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
k Sil SF CH DB DBstar D COP
k_4 0.0792636 0.2942582 306.6924 4.320899 5.211936 0.0233990 0.3676556
k_9 0.0692372 0.0706483 175.8549 4.509085 6.068099 0.0141304 0.3514621
k_7 0.0497536 0.1391297 195.6471 3.601189 4.740963 0.0181718 0.3502824
k_10 0.0460694 0.0883471 135.2359 3.542163 4.435264 0.0143743 0.3398911
k_5 0.0459207 0.2229480 232.7881 3.748984 5.009457 0.0270760 0.3632902
k_8 0.0426182 0.1217283 193.0502 3.451211 4.361179 0.0222442 0.3501777
k_6 0.0418012 0.2473345 252.6956 5.279611 6.589676 0.0254406 0.3570179
k_3 0.0354230 0.3658859 319.9077 5.150333 5.830050 0.0139629 0.3937537
````` ::: ::: ### Cluster with higher Silhouette statistic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sel_clust <- clust[[res_cvi[[1,1]]]] ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_long_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave(filename = "cluster_long.pdf") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Saving 7 x 5 in image ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(sel_clust, type = "centroids", lty = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](cluster_long_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Cluster sizes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} table(sel_clust@cluster) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 1 2 3 4 1512 292 867 282 ``` ::: ::: ## Session info ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sessionInfo() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` R version 4.1.2 (2021-11-01) Platform:
